{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3227638,"name":"","username":"Mara1","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/4af34b/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-08-28T20:50:30.730Z","cooked":"

Hello. We switched out our rio1 for a rio2. Trying to format it following the instructions. Cannot find the rio2 image for 2023. Tried reinstalling the NI tools. Still no image. Only the rio1 image. Thanks.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2023-08-28T20:50:30.730Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":609,"reads":227,"readers_count":226,"score":3090.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":440213,"topic_slug":"robo-rio-2-image","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44530,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/robo-rio-2-image/440213/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3227639,"name":"Ari Meles-Braverman","username":"AriMB","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/arimb/{size}/189989_2.png","created_at":"2023-08-28T20:53:03.888Z","cooked":"

Make sure you’re following the imaging steps for the roboRIO 2, which are different than the roboRIO 1

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

Imaging your roboRIO 2

The NI roboRIO 2.0 boots from a microSD card configured with an appropriate boot image containing the NI Linux Real-Time OS, drivers, and libraries specific to FRC. The microSD card must be imaged ...

Thanks. Yes, we are following the roboRIO2 steps. But there is no Rio2 image when we click on the SD box. Only the rio1 file.

From the above linked doc:

Imaging the roboRIO 2 directly with the roboRIO Imaging Tool is not supported.

Use the Balena Etcher method to write the SD card directly from the PC instead (eg not using the RoboRIO).

Try using the “roboRIO Team Number Setter” tool that comes with WPILib (it should be in the 2023 WPILib Tools folder on the desktop if you’ve installed WPILib).
